content: The Act titled the "Joseph H. Seall Act of 2007" waives the 5-month waiting period for disability benefits for terminally ill beneficiaries. The "Joseph H. Seall Act of 2007" allows the Commissioner of Social Security to waive the waiting period for disability insurance benefits for terminally ill individuals, based on specified criteria. The "Joseph H. Seall Act of 2007" allows the Commissioner of Social Security to waive the waiting period for disability insurance benefits for terminally ill individuals, based on specified criteria. This includes individuals with a medical prognosis of a life expectancy of 6 months or less. Additionally, the Act allows for the waiver of the waiting period for widow's insurance benefits if the Commissioner determines that the individual is terminally ill and that the waiting period would cause undue hardship. The Commissioner of Social Security may waive the waiting period for widow's insurance benefits if the individual is terminally ill with a life expectancy of 6 months or less. Additionally, the commencement of the period of disability can be adjusted under certain conditions. The Commissioner of Social Security may waive the five-month waiting period for disability benefits if the individual is terminally ill with a life expectancy of 6 months or less. This waiver is granted if the waiting period would cause undue hardship, as determined by the Commissioner. The amendments to the Social Security Act will apply to disability benefits based on an individual's wages and self-employment income, as well as applications for disability determinations filed under title II of the Act, starting 90 days after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3. STUDY REGARDING DISABILITY CLAIMS PROCESSING. The Commissioner of Social Security will conduct a study on processing disability insurance claims, including methods used by State agencies and the Social Security Administration, comparing them to other agencies and providers in the private sector. The Commissioner of Social Security will report recommendations on improving disability benefit claim processing methods within 120 days of the Act's enactment to Congressional committees, based on comparisons with other agencies and providers in the private sector.
